Additionally, under the Emergency Planning and Community Right-To-Know Act (Section 302) Avon Zanesville is required to notify state and local authorities of the hazardous and extremely hazardous substances stored over a threshold quantity.  These material disclosures assist the state and local authorities when developing a chemical emergency preparedness plan and coordinating response capabilities and communication.

FIVE-YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY
Avon, Zanesville has had no accidental releases of the subject flammable mixture in the past five years.

EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM
Avon, Zanesville has coordinated with Muskingum County Emergency Management Agency Director and 911 Coordinator, Bo Keck, and the Washington Township Fire Department Chief Gene Hanning.   Mr. Keck and Chief Hanning are very familiar with the site.  Chief Hanning has visited and photographed the location since construction activities were first initiated.  A PowerPoint presentation of the development of the site, its characteristics and features are included in the Washington Township Fire Department's training and the facility is accounted for in the most recent Zanesville Muskingum Area Haz-Mat Plan.  Fire personnel have been trained at the site three (3) times, at the time of the issuance of this plan.  Washington Township Fire Department does have a response plan for the facility, but at this time it is not in written form.  The Washington Township Fire Department is part of the Muskingum County Mutual Aid which is a coordinated effort between multiple Fire Departments in the area.  The Washington Township Fire Department has the most recent building, and fire plans, and completed the 200-foot grid for the fire hoses multiple times.  

Chief Hanning and his team are aware of the Aerosol Product Flammable Mixture Storage Area and the possible contents.  They have re

viewed multiple emergency scenarios, determined appropriate responses, and practiced the responses. At a minimum, Washington Township Fire Department representatives will visit and tour the site annually.  The facility's fire detection system is connected to the Muskingum County 911 Emergency Directory, which is housed at the Muskingum County Sheriff's Department to ensure a rapid response to an emergency.

Avon Zanesville has one (1) covered process, the Handling and Storage of Flammable Aerosol Products that is regulated under the Chemical Accident Prevention Provision of 40 CFR 68.
